name: Aldebaran Serpent
effect:
"You will abandon that mission, Captain. My business
with you takes precedence."

Unless the number of personnel in this crew or Away
Team > lowest attribute present, place on mission.
After experiencing any remaining [Q] icon cards in
this Q-Flash, crew or Away Team is "stopped" and you
must attempt a different mission before attempting
this one again.

name: Android Nightmares
effect:
An infestation of interphasic creatures caused Lt.
Commander Data to experience surreal dreams and
hallucinations, resulting in his attack on Deanna Troi.

If android present, one non-android personnel (random
selection) killed (three if Interphasic Plasma Creatures
affecting you) unless Empathy OR Dr. Soong present.

name: Anti-Matter Pod
effect:
Magnetic anti-matter containment vessel used by the
U.S.S. Enterprise crew to shut down the Manheim Effect
and to mine Cardassian ships in the McAllister C-5 nebula.

May be left at any space mission. Damages next ship
to stop here without 3 Navigation (discard pod). May
be nullified by Transporter Skill. (Not cumulative.)
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Arbiter of Succession
effect:
Jean-Luc Picard was chosen to administer the Klingon Rite
of Succession to select a new High Council Leader. The
ritual concluded when one challenger was killed in battle.

Two strongest Klingon leaders at one location battle. Place
on winner to score points and nullify Klingon Civil War.
If killed, points transfer to opponent. (Not duplicatable.) Points = 10
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

effect:
"You have the power to leave each one of them with
a gift proving your affection."

If you have more cards in your discard pile than
personnel in this crew or Away Team, examine one
card in your discard pile (random selection). If it has a
point box with a number, give it to your opponent who
immediately scores those points. Otherwise, place it
out-of-play. (May not be nullfied.)>

attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Bendii Syndrome
effect:
Rare disease which affects aging Vulcans. A profound loss
of mental control leads to emotional outbursts, elicits
violence in others and eventually kills its victim.

One Vulcan with Youth present (opponent's choice)
dies the next time you score points. Until then, all
your personnel are INTEGRITY -2 where present.

name: Blade of Tkon
effect:
The Tkon Empire was so advanced that it possessed the
ability to move planets at will. The empire became extinct
some 600,000 years ago during the age of Makto.

Immediately relocate any one planet location, and all
cards there, to a different place on the spaceline.
Discard artifact.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Brainwash
effect:
Geordi La Forge was mentally reprogrammed to do the
Romulans' bidding by a machine that accessed his mind
through his VISOR's direct neural implants.

Plays on one personnel you've captured. Captive
reports to your outpost, is under your control and may
mix with your personnel regardless of affiliation.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Calamarain
effect:
An intelligent species that exists as ionized gas and can
travel in space. Penetrated the shields of the U.S.S.
Enterprise seeking revenge on Q in 2366.

Plays at location of opponent's choice. Moves like a ship
(RANGE = 6). May damage (not destroy) one ship OR kill Mortal
Q at same location (discard event). (Immune to Kevin Uxbridge.)
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Canar
effect:
A glowing device used by the Haliians to focus thoughts in
a limited empathic form. Especially used to strengthen an
emotional link during love.

Immediately play on one female personnel. Specify
one male personnel at a different location. If those
two personnel are ever present together, discard both.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Chinese Finger Puzzle
effect:
An ancient novelty which baffled Lt. Commander Data. The
solution to the puzzle, which involves relaxation of effort,
he called "fascinating."

If android present, crew or Away Team is stopped until end
of turn and androids are stopped for X full turns, where
X = number of androids present. Discard dilemma.

Errata - Early-game inconsistency in handling Dual dilemmas,
didn't say 'crew or Away Team'.

name: Colony
effect:
Communities are commonly founded on uninhabited
planets. Many are not charted by the Federation. Communities are commonly founded on uninhabited planets. Many are not charted by the Federation.

Build on any planet mission you completed. Any Away
Team unopposed here at start of its owner's turn scores
1 point for each personnel (2 for each CIVILIAN).

The McAllister C-5, near Minos Korva and the Cardassian

name: Off Switch

Lt. Commander Data has a deactivation switch hidden in
his back. Reluctantly, he informed Dr. Crusher of its
existence to aid in the re-assembly of Lore.

stasis, immune to Android Nightmares, Chinese Finger

Device designed by Geordi La Forge to improve warp

name: Q's Planet
effect: "This is the dressing for a game that we will play."

Owner inserts anywhere on spaceline. Each player may place up to

stocked in Q's Tent. (May not be nullified. Not duplicatable.)

name: Q's Tent
effect:
Place one atop Q's Tent side deck (up to 13 different
cards) during the seed phase. Q's Tent is now open and
in play. OR Stock in deck and use as follows:
Once per turn, play to take a card from tent into your
hand, either your choice (discard doorway) or random
selection (place doorway on top of your draw deck).
Must show card to opponent. Draw no cards this turn.
attributes: • Attributes: Card Logo = STAR TREK THE NEXT GENERATION

name: Q's Vicious Animal Things
effect:
Wearing Napoleonic uniforms and firing musket-shaped
energy weapons, Q's creatures attacked William Riker and
his away team. Worf gave them their colorful moniker.

Unless 22 < STRENGTH < 55, one Away Team member
is killed (random selection) and opponent re-seeds
dilemma under a different unsolved planet mission.

name: Q-Flash
effect:
Place one atop Q-Continuum side deck during the seed
phase. Q-Continuum is now open and in play.
OR Seed under any mission like a dilemma. Any crew
or Away Team encountering this Q-Flash must
experience X cards from opponent's Q-Continuum,
where X = the number of personnel present.
OR Stock in deck and play to nullify one [Q] icon card.
